    <kblmu:OfferingCostsIncludedInAccountsPayableAndAccruedExpenses contextRef="From2016-09-07to2016-12-31" unitRef="USD" decimals="0">75000</kblmu:OfferingCostsIncludedInAccountsPayableAndAccruedExpenses>
    <kblmu:OfferingCostsPaidBySponsorUnderNotePayableRelatedParty contextRef="Context_6ME_01_Jan_2017T00_00_00_TO_30_Jun_2017T00_00_00" unitRef="USD" xsi:nil="true" />
    <kblmu:OfferingCostsPaidBySponsorUnderNotePayableRelatedParty contextRef="From2016-09-07to2016-12-31" unitRef="USD" decimals="0">40000</kblmu:OfferingCostsPaidBySponsorUnderNotePayableRelatedParty>
    <kblmu:DeferredOfferingCostsChargedToAdditionalPaidInCapital contextRef="Context_6ME_01_Jan_2017T00_00_00_TO_30_Jun_2017T00_00_00" unitRef="USD" decimals="0">172750</kblmu:DeferredOfferingCostsChargedToAdditionalPaidInCapital>
    <kblmu:DeferredOfferingCostsChargedToAdditionalPaidInCapital contextRef="From2016-09-07to2016-12-31" unitRef="USD" xsi:nil="true" />
    <us-gaap:OrganizationConsolidationAndPresentationOfFinancialStatementsDisclosureTextBlock contextRef="Context_6ME_01_Jan_2017T00_00_00_TO_30_Jun_2017T00_00_00">&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0"&gt;&lt;b&gt;1. DESCRIPTION OF ORGANIZATION AND BUSINESS OPERATIONS&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;KBL Merger Corp. IV&#13;(the &amp;#8220;Company&amp;#8221;) is a blank check company organized under the laws of the State of Delaware on September 7, 2016. The&#13;Company was formed for the purpose of effecting a merger, share exchange, asset acquisition, share purchase, reorganization or&#13;similar business combination with one or more businesses (&amp;#8220;Business Combination&amp;#8221;). Although the Company is not limited&#13;to a particular industry or geographic region for purposes of consummating a Business Combination, the Company intends to focus&#13;on the healthcare and related wellness industry. The Company is an emerging growth company and, as such, the Company is subject&#13;to all of the risks associated with early stage and emerging growth companies.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;At December 31, 2017,&#13;the Company had not yet commenced operations. All activity through December 31, 2017 relates to the Company&amp;#8217;s formation,&#13;its initial public offering (&amp;#8220;Initial Public Offering&amp;#8221;), which is described below, and identifying a target company&#13;for a Business Combination. The Company will not generate any operating revenues until after completion of its initial Business&#13;Combination, at the earliest. The Company will generate non-operating income in the form of interest income from the proceeds held&#13;in trust derived from the Initial Public Offering and the Private Placement (defined below).&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;The registration statement&#13;for the Company&amp;#8217;s Initial Public Offering was declared effective on June 1, 2017. On June 7, 2017, the Company consummated&#13;the Initial Public Offering of 10,000,000 units at $10.00 per unit (&amp;#8220;Units&amp;#8221; and, with respect to the shares of the&#13;Company&amp;#8217;s common stock included in the Units offered, the &amp;#8220;Public Shares&amp;#8221;), generating gross proceeds of $100,000,000,&#13;which is described in Note 3.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;Simultaneously with&#13;the closing of the Initial Public Offering, the Company consummated the private placement (&amp;#8220;Private Placement&amp;#8221;) of&amp;#160;450,000&#13;units (&amp;#8220;Private Units&amp;#8221; and, with respect to the shares of the Company&amp;#8217;s common stock included in the Private&#13;Units offered, the &amp;#8220;Private Shares&amp;#8221;) at a price of&amp;#160;$10.00 per Private Unit in a private placement to the Company&amp;#8217;s&#13;sponsor, KBL IV Sponsor LLC (the &amp;#8220;Sponsor&amp;#8221;), and the underwriters, generating gross proceeds of $4,500,000, which is&#13;described in Note 3.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;On June 23, 2017, in connection with the underwriters&amp;#8217;&#13;election to fully exercise their over-allotment option, the Company consummated the sale of an additional 1,500,000 Units at $10.00&#13;per Unit and the sale of an additional 52,500 Private Units at $10.00 per Private Unit, generating total gross proceeds of $15,525,000.&#13;Following the closing, an additional $15,150,000 of net proceeds ($10.10 per Unit) was placed in the Trust Account, resulting in&#13;$116,150,000 ($10.10 per Unit) held in the Trust Account (defined below).&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;Transaction costs amounted to $7,345,436, consisting&#13;of $2,875,000 of underwriting fees, $4,025,000 of deferred underwriting fees (see Note 5) and $445,436 of Initial Public Offering&#13;costs.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Trust Account&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;Following the closing of the Initial Public&#13;Offering and the Private Placement, an amount of $101,000,000 ($10.10 per Unit) from the net proceeds of the sale of the Units&#13;in the Initial Public Offering and the Private Units was placed in a trust account (&amp;#8220;Trust Account&amp;#8221;) and invested in&#13;U.S. government securities, within the meaning set forth in Section 2(a)(16) of the Investment Company Act of 1940, as amended&#13;(the &amp;#8220;Investment Company Act&amp;#8221;), with a maturity of 180 days or less or in any open-ended investment company that holds&#13;itself out as a money market fund selected by the Company meeting the conditions of Rule 2a-7 of the Investment Company Act, as&#13;determined by the Company.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;The Company&amp;#8217;s amended and restated certificate&#13;of incorporation provides that, other than the withdrawal of interest to pay income taxes, if any, none of the funds held in the&#13;Trust Account will be released until the earlier of: (i) the completion of a Business Combination or (ii) the distribution of the&#13;Trust Account, as described below.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;The Company&amp;#8217;s management has broad discretion&#13;with respect to the specific application of the net proceeds of its Initial Public Offering and Private Units, although substantially&#13;all of the net proceeds are intended to be applied generally toward consummating a Business Combination. There is no assurance&#13;that the Company will be able to complete a Business Combination successfully. The Company must complete one or more initial Business&#13;Combinations having an aggregate fair market value of at least 80% of the assets held in the Trust Account (excluding the deferred&#13;underwriting commissions and taxes payable on income earned on the Trust Account) at the time of the agreement to enter into the&#13;initial Business Combination. However, the Company will only complete a Business Combination if the post-transaction company owns&#13;or acquires 50% or more of the outstanding voting securities of the target or otherwise acquires a controlling interest in the&#13;target sufficient for it not to be required to register as an investment company under the Investment Company Act.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;The Company will provide holders of the outstanding&#13;Public Shares (&amp;#8220;public stockholders&amp;#8221;) with the opportunity to redeem all or a portion of their Public Shares upon the&#13;completion of a Business Combination either (i) in connection with a stockholder meeting called to approve the Business Combination&#13;or (ii) by means of a tender offer. The decision as to whether the Company will seek stockholder approval of a Business Combination&#13;or conduct a tender offer will be made by the Company, solely in its discretion. The public stockholders will be entitled to redeem&#13;their Public Shares for a pro rata portion of the amount then in the Trust Account ($10.10 per share, plus any pro rata interest&#13;earned on the funds held in the Trust Account and not previously released to the Company for tax obligations). The per-share amount&#13;to be distributed to public stockholders who redeem their Public Shares will not be reduced by the deferred underwriting commissions&#13;the Company will pay to the underwriters (as discussed in Note 5). The Company will proceed with a Business Combination if the&#13;Company has net tangible assets of at least $5,000,001 upon such consummation of a Business Combination and, if the Company seeks&#13;stockholder approval, a majority of the shares voted are voted in favor of the Business Combination.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: center"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: center"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;If a stockholder vote&#13;is not required by law and the Company does not decide to hold a stockholder vote for business or other legal reasons, the Company&#13;will, pursuant to its amended and restated certificate of incorporation, conduct the redemptions pursuant to the tender offer rules&#13;of the Securities and Exchange Commission (&amp;#8220;SEC&amp;#8221;), and file tender offer documents with the SEC prior to completing&#13;a Business Combination. If, however, a stockholder approval of the transactions is required by law, or the Company decides to obtain&#13;stockholder approval for business or legal reasons, the Company will offer to redeem shares in conjunction with a proxy solicitation&#13;pursuant to the proxy rules and not pursuant to the tender offer rules. Additionally, each public stockholder may elect to redeem&#13;their Public Shares irrespective of whether they vote for or against the proposed transaction. If the Company seeks stockholder&#13;approval in connection with a Business Combination, the initial stockholder (as defined below), officers and directors have agreed&#13;to vote their Founder Shares (as defined in Note 4), Private Shares, and any Public Shares purchased during or after the Initial&#13;Public Offering in favor of a Business Combination. In addition, the initial stockholder, officers and directors have agreed to&#13;waive their redemption rights with respect to their Founder Shares, Private Shares and Public Shares in connection with the completion&#13;of a Business Combination.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;Notwithstanding the&#13;foregoing, the Company&amp;#8217;s amended and restated certificate of incorporation provides that a public stockholder, together with&#13;any affiliate of such stockholder or any other person with whom such stockholder is acting in concert or as a &amp;#8220;group&amp;#8221;&#13;(as defined under Section 13 of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended (the &amp;#8220;Exchange Act&amp;#8221;), will be restricted&#13;from redeeming its shares with respect to more than an aggregate of 15% or more of the Public Shares.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;The Company&amp;#8217;s&#13;Sponsor (the &amp;#8220;initial stockholder&amp;#8221;), officers and directors agreed not to propose an amendment to the Company&amp;#8217;s&#13;amended and restated article of incorporation that would affect the substance or timing of the Company&amp;#8217;s obligation to redeem&#13;100% of its Public Shares if the Company does not complete a Business Combination, unless the Company provides the public stockholders&#13;with the opportunity to redeem their shares of the Company&amp;#8217;s common stock in conjunction with any such amendment.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;If the Company is&#13;unable to complete a Business Combination within 18 months (or 21 months, as applicable) from the closing of the Initial Public&#13;Offering (the &amp;#8220;Combination Period&amp;#8221;), the Company will (i) cease all operations except for the purpose of winding up,&#13;(ii) as promptly as reasonably possible but not more than ten business days thereafter, redeem the Public Shares, at a per-share&#13;price, payable in cash, equal to the aggregate amount then on deposit in the Trust Account, including interest (which interest&#13;shall be net of taxes payable and less up to $50,000 of interest to pay dissolution expenses), divided by the number of then outstanding&#13;Public Shares, which redemption will completely extinguish public stockholders&amp;#8217; rights as stockholders (including the right&#13;to receive further liquidation distributions, if any), subject to applicable law, and (iii) as promptly as reasonably possible&#13;following such redemption, subject to the approval of the remaining stockholders and the Company&amp;#8217;s Board of Directors, dissolve&#13;and liquidate, subject in the case of clauses (ii) and (iii) to the Company&amp;#8217;s obligations under Delaware law to provide for&#13;claims of creditors and the requirements of other applicable law. There are no redemption rights or liquidating distributions with&#13;respect to the Company&amp;#8217;s Rights, Warrants, Private Placement Warrants (as defined in Note 3) and the rights underlying the&#13;Private Units, which will expire worthless if the Company fails to complete its Business Combination within the Combination Period.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;In connection with&#13;the redemption of 100% of the Company&amp;#8217;s outstanding Public Shares for a portion of the funds held in the Trust Account, each&#13;holder will receive a full pro rata portion of the amount then in the Trust Account, plus any pro rata interest earned on the funds&#13;held in the Trust Account and not previously released to the Company for taxes payable and up to $50,000 of interest to pay dissolution&#13;expenses.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;The initial stockholder,&#13;officers, directors and underwriters agreed to waive their liquidation rights with respect to the Founder Shares and Private Shares&#13;if the Company fails to complete a Business Combination within the Combination Period. However, if they should acquire Public Shares&#13;in or after the Initial Public Offering, they will be entitled to liquidating distributions from the Trust Account with respect&#13;to such Public Shares if the Company fails to complete a Business Combination within the Combination Period. The underwriters agreed&#13;to waive their rights to their deferred underwriting commission (see Note 5) held in the Trust Account in the event the Company&#13;does not complete a Business Combination within in the Combination Period and, in such event, such amounts will be included with&#13;the other funds held in the Trust Account that will be available to fund the redemption of the Company&amp;#8217;s Public Shares. In&#13;the event of such distribution, it is possible that the per share value of the residual assets remaining available for distribution&#13;(including Trust Account assets) will be only $10.10 per share initially held in the Trust Account. In order to protect the amounts&#13;held in the Trust Account, the Sponsor agreed to be liable to the Company if and to the extent any claims by a vendor for services&#13;rendered or products sold to the Company, or a prospective target business with which the Company has discussed entering into a&#13;transaction agreement, reduce the amount of funds in the Trust Account. This liability will not apply with respect to any claims&#13;by a third party who executed a waiver of any right, title, interest or claim of any kind in or to any monies held in the Trust&#13;Account or to any claims under the Company&amp;#8217;s indemnity of the underwriters of the Initial Public Offering against certain&#13;liabilities, including liabilities under the Securities Act of 1933, as amended (the &amp;#8220;Securities Act&amp;#8221;). Moreover, in&#13;the event that an executed waiver is deemed to be unenforceable against a third party, the Sponsor will not be responsible to the&#13;extent of any liability for such third party claims. The Company will seek to reduce the possibility that the Sponsor will have&#13;to indemnify the Trust Account due to claims of creditors by endeavoring to have all vendors, service providers prospective target&#13;businesses or other entities with which the Company does business, execute agreements with the Company waiving any right, title,&#13;interest or claim of any kind in or to monies held in the Trust Account.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: center"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&#13;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Liquidity&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;As of December 31,&#13;2017, the Company had a cash balance of approximately $428,000, which excludes interest income of approximately $663,000 from the&#13;Company&amp;#8217;s investments in the Trust Account which is available to the Company for tax obligations.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;The Company intends&#13;to use substantially all of the funds held in the Trust Account, including any amounts representing interest earned on the Trust&#13;Account (less taxes payable and deferred underwriting commissions) to complete its initial Business Combination. To the extent&#13;necessary, the Sponsor or an affiliate of the Sponsor, or certain of the Company&amp;#8217;s officers and directors may, but are not&#13;obligated to, loan the Company funds as may be required, up to $1,000,000. Such loans may be convertible into units of the post&#13;Business Combination entity at a price of $10.00 per unit. The units would be identical to the Private Units (see Note 4).&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;Based on the foregoing,&#13;management believes that the Company will have sufficient working capital to meet the Company&amp;#8217;s needs through December 7, 2018,&#13;the scheduled liquidation date. Over this time period, the Company will be using these funds for paying existing accounts payable,&#13;identifying and evaluating prospective acquisition candidates, performing business due diligence on prospective target businesses,&#13;traveling to and from the offices, plants or similar locations of prospective target businesses, reviewing corporate documents&#13;and material agreements of prospective target businesses, selecting the target business to acquire and structuring, negotiating&#13;and consummating the business combination.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Going Concern&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;In connection with&#13;the Company&amp;#8217;s assessment of going concern considerations in accordance with Financial Accounting Standard Board&amp;#8217;s Accounting Standards&#13;Update (&amp;#8220;ASU&amp;#8221;) 2014-15, &amp;#8220;Disclosures of Uncertainties about an Entity&amp;#8217;s Ability to Continue as a Going Concern,&amp;#8221;&#13;management has determined that the mandatory liquidation and subsequent dissolution raises substantial doubt about the Company&amp;#8217;s&#13;ability to continue as a going concern. No adjustments have been made to the carrying amounts of assets or liabilities should the&#13;Company be required to liquidate after December 7, 2018.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:OrganizationConsolidationAndPresentationOfFinancialStatementsDisclosureTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:Cash contextRef="Context_As_Of_30_Jun_2017T00_00_00_TO_30_Jun_2017T00_00_00" unitRef="USD" decimals="0">428000</us-gaap:Cash>
    <us-gaap:InterestIncomeOperating contextRef="Context_6ME_01_Jan_2017T00_00_00_TO_30_Jun_2017T00_00_00" unitRef="USD" decimals="0">663000</us-gaap:InterestIncomeOperating>
    <us-gaap:SignificantAccountingPoliciesTextBlock contextRef="Context_6ME_01_Jan_2017T00_00_00_TO_30_Jun_2017T00_00_00">&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left"&gt;&lt;b&gt;2. SUMMARY OF SIGNIFICANT ACCOUNTING&#13;POLICIES&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Basis of presentation&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;The accompanying financial&#13;statements are presented in U.S. dollars in conformity with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States of America&#13;(&amp;#8220;GAAP&amp;#8221;) and pursuant to the rules and regulations of the SEC.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Emerging growth company&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;The Company is an&#13;&amp;#8220;emerging growth company&amp;#8221; as defined in Section 2(a) of the Securities Act, as modified by the Jumpstart Our Business&#13;Startups Act of 2012 (the &amp;#8220;JOBS Act&amp;#8221;), and it may take advantage of certain exemptions from various reporting requirements&#13;that are applicable to other public companies that are not emerging growth companies including, but not limited to, not being required&#13;to comply with the auditor attestation requirements of Section 404 of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act, reduced disclosure obligations regarding&#13;executive compensation in its periodic reports and proxy statements, and exemptions from the requirements of holding a nonbinding&#13;advisory vote on executive compensation and stockholder approval of any golden parachute payments not previously approved.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;Further, Section 102(b)(1)&#13;of the JOBS Act exempts emerging growth companies from being required to comply with new or revised financial accounting standards&#13;until private companies (that is, those that have not had a Securities Act registration statement declared effective or do not&#13;have a class of securities registered under the Exchange Act) are required to comply with the new or revised financial accounting&#13;standards. The JOBS Act provides that a company can elect to opt out of the extended transition period and comply with the requirements&#13;that apply to non-emerging growth companies but any such election to opt out is irrevocable. The Company has elected not to opt&#13;out of such extended transition period which means that when a standard is issued or revised and it has different application dates&#13;for public or private companies, the Company, as an emerging growth company, can adopt the new or revised standard at the time&#13;private companies adopt the new or revised standard. This may make comparison of the Company&amp;#8217;s financial statements with&#13;another public company which is neither an emerging growth company nor an emerging growth company which has opted out of using&#13;the extended transition period difficult or impossible because of the potential differences in accounting standards used.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: center"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Use of estimates&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;The preparation of&#13;financial statements in conformity with GAAP requires management to make estimates and assumptions that affect the reported amounts&#13;of assets and liabilities and disclosure of contingent assets and liabilities at the date of the financial statements and the reported&#13;amounts of revenues and expenses during the reporting periods.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;Making estimates requires&#13;management to exercise significant judgment. It is at least reasonably possible that the estimate of the effect of a condition,&#13;situation or set of circumstances that existed at the date of the financial statements, which management considered in formulating&#13;its estimate, could change in the near term due to one or more future confirming events. Accordingly, the actual results could&#13;differ significantly from our estimates.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Cash and cash equivalents&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;The Company considers&#13;all short-term investments with an original maturity of three months or less when purchased to be cash equivalents. The Company&#13;did not have any cash equivalents as of December 31, 2017 and 2016.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Cash and marketable securities held in Trust Account&lt;/b&gt;&#13;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;At December 31, 2017,&#13;assets held in the Trust Account were comprised of $16,699 in cash and $116,571,318 in U.S. Treasury Bills.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Common stock subject to possible redemption&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;The Company accounts&#13;for its common stock subject to possible redemption in accordance with the guidance in Accounting Standards Codification (&amp;#8220;ASC&amp;#8221;)&#13;Topic 480 &amp;#8220;Distinguishing Liabilities from Equity.&amp;#8221; Common stock subject to mandatory redemption (if any) are classified&#13;as liability instruments and are measured at fair value. Conditionally redeemable common stock (including common stock that feature&#13;redemption rights that are either within the control of the holder or subject to redemption upon the occurrence of uncertain events&#13;not solely within the Company&amp;#8217;s control) are classified as temporary equity. At all other times, common stock are classified&#13;as stockholders&amp;#8217; equity. The Company&amp;#8217;s common stock features certain redemption rights that are considered to be outside&#13;of the Company&amp;#8217;s control and subject to occurrence of uncertain future events. Accordingly, at December 31, 2017, 10,675,764&#13;shares of common stock subject to possible redemption at the redemption amount are presented as temporary equity, outside of the&#13;stockholders&amp;#8217; equity section of the Company&amp;#8217;s balance sheet.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left"&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Offering costs&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;Offering costs consisting&#13;of legal, accounting, underwriting fees and other costs amounting to $7,345,436 that were directly related to the Initial Public&#13;Offering were charged to stockholders&amp;#8217; equity upon the completion of the Initial Public Offering on June 7, 2017.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Income taxes&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;The Company complies&#13;with the accounting and reporting requirements of ASC Topic 740 &amp;#8220;Income Taxes,&amp;#8221; which requires an asset and liability&#13;approach to financial accounting and reporting for income taxes. Deferred income tax assets and liabilities are computed for differences&#13;between the financial statement and tax bases of assets and liabilities that will result in future taxable or deductible amounts,&#13;based on enacted tax laws and rates applicable to the periods in which the differences are expected to affect taxable income. Valuation&#13;allowances are established, when necessary, to reduce deferred tax assets to the amount expected to be realized.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;ASC Topic 740 prescribes&#13;a recognition threshold and a measurement attribute for the financial statement recognition and measurement of tax positions taken&#13;or expected to be taken in a tax return. For those benefits to be recognized, a tax position must be more-likely-than-not to be&#13;sustained upon examination by taxing authorities. The Company&amp;#8217;s management determined that Delaware is the Company&amp;#8217;s&#13;only major tax jurisdiction. The Company recognizes accrued interest and penalties related to unrecognized tax benefits as income&#13;tax expense. As of December 31, 2017 and 2016, there were no unrecognized tax benefits and no amounts accrued for interest and&#13;penalties. The Company is currently not aware of any issues under review that could result in significant payments, accruals or&#13;material deviation from its position.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;The Company may be&#13;subject to potential examination by federal or state taxing authorities in the areas of income taxes. These potential examinations&#13;may include questioning the timing and amount of deductions, the nexus of income among various tax jurisdictions and compliance&#13;with federal and state tax laws. The Company&amp;#8217;s management does not expect that the total amount of unrecognized tax benefits&#13;will materially change over the next twelve months.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Net income (loss) per common share&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;The Company complies&#13;with accounting and disclosure requirements ASC Topic 260, &amp;#8220;Earnings Per Share.&amp;#8221; Net income (loss) per common share&#13;is computed by dividing net income (loss) by the weighted average number of common shares outstanding for the period. Shares of&#13;common stock subject to possible redemption at December 31, 2017 have been excluded from the calculation of basic income per share&#13;for the year ended December 31, 2017 since such shares, if redeemed, only participate in their pro rata share of the Trust Account&#13;earnings. The Company has not considered the effect of (1) warrants sold in the Initial Public Offering and Private Placement to&#13;purchase 6,001,250 shares of common stock and (2) rights sold in the Initial Public Offering and Private Placement that convert&#13;into 1,200,250 shares of common stock, in the calculation of diluted income (loss) per share, since the exercise of the warrants&#13;and the conversion of the rights into shares of common stock is contingent upon the occurrence of future events and the inclusion&#13;of such warrants and rights would be anti-dilutive.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: center"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Concentration of credit risk&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;Financial instruments&#13;that potentially subject the Company to concentration of credit risk consist of a cash account in a financial institution which,&#13;at times may exceed the Federal depository insurance coverage of $250,000. At December 31, 2017 and 2016, the Company had not experienced&#13;losses on this account and management believes the Company is not exposed to significant risks on such account.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Fair value of financial instruments&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;The fair value of&#13;the Company&amp;#8217;s assets and liabilities, which qualify as financial instruments under ASC Topic 820, &amp;#8220;Fair Value Measurements&#13;and Disclosures,&amp;#8221; approximates the carrying amounts represented in the accompanying balance sheets, primarily due to their&#13;short-term nature.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Recently issued accounting standards&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;Management does not&#13;believe that any recently issued, but not yet effective, accounting pronouncements, if currently adopted, would have a material&#13;effect on the Company&amp;#8217;s financial statements.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:SignificantAccountingPoliciesTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:BasisOfAccountingPolicyPolicyTextBlock contextRef="Context_6ME_01_Jan_2017T00_00_00_TO_30_Jun_2017T00_00_00">&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Basis of presentation&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;The accompanying financial&#13;statements are presented in U.S. dollars in conformity with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States of America&#13;(&amp;#8220;GAAP&amp;#8221;) and pursuant to the rules and regulations of the SEC.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:BasisOfAccountingPolicyPolicyTextBlock>
    <kblmu:EmergingGrowthCompanyPolicyTextBlock contextRef="Context_6ME_01_Jan_2017T00_00_00_TO_30_Jun_2017T00_00_00">&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Emerging growth company&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;The Company is an&#13;&amp;#8220;emerging growth company&amp;#8221; as defined in Section 2(a) of the Securities Act, as modified by the Jumpstart Our Business&#13;Startups Act of 2012 (the &amp;#8220;JOBS Act&amp;#8221;), and it may take advantage of certain exemptions from various reporting requirements&#13;that are applicable to other public companies that are not emerging growth companies including, but not limited to, not being required&#13;to comply with the auditor attestation requirements of Section 404 of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act, reduced disclosure obligations regarding&#13;executive compensation in its periodic reports and proxy statements, and exemptions from the requirements of holding a nonbinding&#13;advisory vote on executive compensation and stockholder approval of any golden parachute payments not previously approved.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;Further, Section 102(b)(1)&#13;of the JOBS Act exempts emerging growth companies from being required to comply with new or revised financial accounting standards&#13;until private companies (that is, those that have not had a Securities Act registration statement declared effective or do not&#13;have a class of securities registered under the Exchange Act) are required to comply with the new or revised financial accounting&#13;standards. The JOBS Act provides that a company can elect to opt out of the extended transition period and comply with the requirements&#13;that apply to non-emerging growth companies but any such election to opt out is irrevocable. The Company has elected not to opt&#13;out of such extended transition period which means that when a standard is issued or revised and it has different application dates&#13;for public or private companies, the Company, as an emerging growth company, can adopt the new or revised standard at the time&#13;private companies adopt the new or revised standard. This may make comparison of the Company&amp;#8217;s financial statements with&#13;another public company which is neither an emerging growth company nor an emerging growth company which has opted out of using&#13;the extended transition period difficult or impossible because of the potential differences in accounting standards used.&lt;/p&gt;</kblmu:EmergingGrowthCompanyPolicyTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:UseOfEstimates contextRef="Context_6ME_01_Jan_2017T00_00_00_TO_30_Jun_2017T00_00_00">&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Use of estimates&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;The preparation of&#13;financial statements in conformity with GAAP requires management to make estimates and assumptions that affect the reported amounts&#13;of assets and liabilities and disclosure of contingent assets and liabilities at the date of the financial statements and the reported&#13;amounts of revenues and expenses during the reporting periods.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;Making estimates requires&#13;management to exercise significant judgment. It is at least reasonably possible that the estimate of the effect of a condition,&#13;situation or set of circumstances that existed at the date of the financial statements, which management considered in formulating&#13;its estimate, could change in the near term due to one or more future confirming events. Accordingly, the actual results could&#13;differ significantly from our estimates.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:UseOfEstimates>
    <us-gaap:CashAndCashEquivalentsPolicyTextBlock contextRef="Context_6ME_01_Jan_2017T00_00_00_TO_30_Jun_2017T00_00_00">&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Cash and cash equivalents&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;The Company considers&#13;all short-term investments with an original maturity of three months or less when purchased to be cash equivalents. The Company&#13;did not have any cash equivalents as of December 31, 2017 and 2016.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:CashAndCashEquivalentsPolicyTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:MarketableSecuritiesHeldToMaturitySecuritiesPolicy contextRef="Context_6ME_01_Jan_2017T00_00_00_TO_30_Jun_2017T00_00_00">&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Cash and marketable securities held in Trust Account&lt;/b&gt;&#13;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;At December 31, 2017,&#13;assets held in the Trust Account were comprised of $16,699 in cash and $116,571,318 in U.S. Treasury Bills.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:MarketableSecuritiesHeldToMaturitySecuritiesPolicy>
    <us-gaap:SharesSubjectToMandatoryRedemptionChangesInRedemptionValuePolicyTextBlock contextRef="Context_6ME_01_Jan_2017T00_00_00_TO_30_Jun_2017T00_00_00">&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Common stock subject to possible redemption&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;The Company accounts&#13;for its common stock subject to possible redemption in accordance with the guidance in Accounting Standards Codification (&amp;#8220;ASC&amp;#8221;)&#13;Topic 480 &amp;#8220;Distinguishing Liabilities from Equity.&amp;#8221; Common stock subject to mandatory redemption (if any) are classified&#13;as liability instruments and are measured at fair value. Conditionally redeemable common stock (including common stock that feature&#13;redemption rights that are either within the control of the holder or subject to redemption upon the occurrence of uncertain events&#13;not solely within the Company&amp;#8217;s control) are classified as temporary equity. At all other times, common stock are classified&#13;as stockholders&amp;#8217; equity. The Company&amp;#8217;s common stock features certain redemption rights that are considered to be outside&#13;of the Company&amp;#8217;s control and subject to occurrence of uncertain future events. Accordingly, at December 31, 2017, 10,675,764&#13;shares of common stock subject to possible redemption at the redemption amount are presented as temporary equity, outside of the&#13;stockholders&amp;#8217; equity section of the Company&amp;#8217;s balance sheet.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:SharesSubjectToMandatoryRedemptionChangesInRedemptionValuePolicyTextBlock>
    <kblmu:OfferingCostsPolicyTextBlock contextRef="Context_6ME_01_Jan_2017T00_00_00_TO_30_Jun_2017T00_00_00">&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Offering costs&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;Offering costs consisting&#13;of legal, accounting, underwriting fees and other costs amounting to $7,345,436 that were directly related to the Initial Public&#13;Offering were charged to stockholders&amp;#8217; equity upon the completion of the Initial Public Offering on June 7, 2017.&lt;/p&gt;</kblmu:OfferingCostsPolicyTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:IncomeTaxPolicyTextBlock contextRef="Context_6ME_01_Jan_2017T00_00_00_TO_30_Jun_2017T00_00_00">&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Income taxes&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;The Company complies&#13;with the accounting and reporting requirements of ASC Topic 740 &amp;#8220;Income Taxes,&amp;#8221; which requires an asset and liability&#13;approach to financial accounting and reporting for income taxes. Deferred income tax assets and liabilities are computed for differences&#13;between the financial statement and tax bases of assets and liabilities that will result in future taxable or deductible amounts,&#13;based on enacted tax laws and rates applicable to the periods in which the differences are expected to affect taxable income. Valuation&#13;allowances are established, when necessary, to reduce deferred tax assets to the amount expected to be realized.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;ASC Topic 740 prescribes&#13;a recognition threshold and a measurement attribute for the financial statement recognition and measurement of tax positions taken&#13;or expected to be taken in a tax return. For those benefits to be recognized, a tax position must be more-likely-than-not to be&#13;sustained upon examination by taxing authorities. The Company&amp;#8217;s management determined that Delaware is the Company&amp;#8217;s&#13;only major tax jurisdiction. The Company recognizes accrued interest and penalties related to unrecognized tax benefits as income&#13;tax expense. As of December 31, 2017 and 2016, there were no unrecognized tax benefits and no amounts accrued for interest and&#13;penalties. The Company is currently not aware of any issues under review that could result in significant payments, accruals or&#13;material deviation from its position.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;The Company may be&#13;subject to potential examination by federal or state taxing authorities in the areas of income taxes. These potential examinations&#13;may include questioning the timing and amount of deductions, the nexus of income among various tax jurisdictions and compliance&#13;with federal and state tax laws. The Company&amp;#8217;s management does not expect that the total amount of unrecognized tax benefits&#13;will materially change over the next twelve months.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:IncomeTaxPolicyTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:EarningsPerSharePolicyTextBlock contextRef="Context_6ME_01_Jan_2017T00_00_00_TO_30_Jun_2017T00_00_00">&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Net income (loss) per common share&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;The Company complies&#13;with accounting and disclosure requirements ASC Topic 260, &amp;#8220;Earnings Per Share.&amp;#8221; Net income (loss) per common share&#13;is computed by dividing net income (loss) by the weighted average number of common shares outstanding for the period. Shares of&#13;common stock subject to possible redemption at December 31, 2017 have been excluded from the calculation of basic income per share&#13;for the year ended December 31, 2017 since such shares, if redeemed, only participate in their pro rata share of the Trust Account&#13;earnings. The Company has not considered the effect of (1) warrants sold in the Initial Public Offering and Private Placement to&#13;purchase 6,001,250 shares of common stock and (2) rights sold in the Initial Public Offering and Private Placement that convert&#13;into 1,200,250 shares of common stock, in the calculation of diluted income (loss) per share, since the exercise of the warrants&#13;and the conversion of the rights into shares of common stock is contingent upon the occurrence of future events and the inclusion&#13;of such warrants and rights would be anti-dilutive.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:EarningsPerSharePolicyTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:ConcentrationRiskCreditRisk contextRef="Context_6ME_01_Jan_2017T00_00_00_TO_30_Jun_2017T00_00_00">&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Concentration of credit risk&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;Financial instruments&#13;that potentially subject the Company to concentration of credit risk consist of a cash account in a financial institution which,&#13;at times may exceed the Federal depository insurance coverage of $250,000. At December 31, 2017 and 2016, the Company had not experienced&#13;losses on this account and management believes the Company is not exposed to significant risks on such account.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:ConcentrationRiskCreditRisk>
    <us-gaap:FairValueOfFinancialInstrumentsPolicy contextRef="Context_6ME_01_Jan_2017T00_00_00_TO_30_Jun_2017T00_00_00">&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Fair value of financial instruments&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;The fair value of&#13;the Company&amp;#8217;s assets and liabilities, which qualify as financial instruments under ASC Topic 820, &amp;#8220;Fair Value Measurements&#13;and Disclosures,&amp;#8221; approximates the carrying amounts represented in the accompanying balance sheets, primarily due to their&#13;short-term nature.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:FairValueOfFinancialInstrumentsPolicy>
    <us-gaap:NewAccountingPronouncementsPolicyPolicyTextBlock contextRef="Context_6ME_01_Jan_2017T00_00_00_TO_30_Jun_2017T00_00_00">&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Recently issued accounting standards&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0.25in"&gt;Management does not&#13;believe that any recently issued, but not yet effective, accounting pronouncements, if currently adopted, would have a material&#13;effect on the Company&amp;#8217;s financial statements.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:NewAccountingPronouncementsPolicyPolicyTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:AssetsHeldInTrust contextRef="Context_As_Of_30_Jun_2017T00_00_00_TO_30_Jun_2017T00_00_00" unitRef="USD" decimals="0">16699</us-gaap:AssetsHeldInTrust>
